column5: Took a buddy out yesterday on Simcoe, looking for his first laker.  We decided to walk which was probably the worst idea we ever had.  You've got to earn your fish right now with knee deep drifts everywhere and slush pockets over our boots in some spots, but we made it.  Almost 2 kilometers and 17 panting, please find me an inhaler air breaks later, we set up shop in 78 fow.  Marked fish immediately, but they didnt bite for about 30 mins.  Then, they turned on. We were fishing by 9am, off the water by 2:30pm and we landed 16 whiteys and 2 lakers.  Lost about the same number within the first few feet of the fight, tiny mouths on those things haha. I also caught the fattest little laker I've ever seen.  I said when I got it, I'll bet theres 20 smelt in that thing... final tally? 16 smelt, 1 goby Stopped filming most of them, but I do have some clips I added and some pics as well.  Enjoy!       http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3ETXCF6wO70
What a chubby Laker.  It must have been something slogging through all that snow.  I am glad you were rewarded with an amazing day.
nice going  I hope the slush isn't too bad on the weekend
wow, what a great day! Glad all your effort paid off and thanks for posting!
nice work, I'll be out there hunting for lakers n whities saturday morning. hopefully the bite keeps up!
im headed out sunday!! i hope i get into them  good job steve
Man thats awesome dude, thanks for sharing!  MTBF  PS check FB
